>>1)In Exp 3(a) CTFS-CTFT , for a periodic signal with period 2.5 s, the spectral content at 0.4 Hz corresponds to which harmonic in the CTFS harmonic plot?<< ( ) 2 (x) 1 ( ) 0.5
>>2) For a periodic signal which one of the following statements characterize the relationship between number of harmonics within a fixed frequency band and time period of the signal ?<< (x) By increasing the time period number of harmonics will increase. ( ) By increasing the time period number of harmonics will decrease. ( ) By increasing the time period number of harmonics will have no change.
>>3) In exp 3(e) CTFT-DTFT, for what value of the sampling rate the impulse-sampled version of continuous time signal x(t) matches with the given discrete time signal x[n] ?<< (x) 2 Hz ( ) 1 Hz ( ) 0.5 Hz
>>4) In exp 3(c), what is the frequency of the spectral component corresponding to 4th harmonic for the corresponding normalized frequency components when the period is set to 5 ?<< (x) 0.08 ( ) 0.06 ( ) 1.00
>>5) A continuous-time signal x(t) has a Fourier Transform X(w). The Fourier transform of the time shifted signal x(t+p) would be given by<< ( ) X(w)exp(-jwp) (x) X(w)exp(jwp) ( ) X(w)
>>6) If a signal is discrete in one domain(time/frequency), then its equivalent representation in the other domain would be<< (x) Periodic ( ) Aperiodic
>>7) "The total energy of all discrete time n is equal to the total energy in one fundamental frequency" - this statement is better known as<< ( ) Nyquist Sampling Theorem (x) Parseval's Theorem ( ) Duality in time and frequency domain
